lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.code: """"Return -1, 0, or 1 according to a comparison first by type,
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: then by class, and finally by each of fields.""" # " <- for emacs
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """Return true iff a and b have the same lowercase representation.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: return a == b or string.lower(a) == string.lower(b)
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Return a list of consecutive data files.
lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.code: # detects the condition where we're searching past the end
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # of the file, which is otherwise difficult to detect
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: for file, size in files: # Seek across multiple files (i.e., data.noun1 + data.noun2).
lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.code: if offset < size:    # Purpose: Google App Engine requires filesize < 10MB.
lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.code: """Return the index of key within sequence, using testfn for
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: comparison and transforming items of sequence by keyfn first.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: if (not testfn and value == key) or (testfn and testfn(value, key)):
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """Partition sequence into count subsequences of size
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: Return (partitions, remainder), where partitions is a sequence of
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: count subsequences of cardinality count, and
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: for index in range(0, size * count, size):
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Some kind of cache is necessary since Sense -> Synset references are
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # stored by key, and it's nice not to have to cons a new copy of a
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Synset that's been paged in each time a Sense's synset is retrieved.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # Ideally, we'd use a weak dict, but there aren't any.  A strong dict
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # reintroduces the problem that eliminating the Sense <-> Synset
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # circularity was intended to resolve: every entity ever seen is
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # preserved forever, making operations that iterate over the entire
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # The LRUCache approximates a weak dict in the case where temporal
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """ A cache of values such that least recently used element is
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: is a dict from timestamp -> key
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: is the timestamp to use with the next value that's added.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: The timestamp of the oldest element (the next one to remove),
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: This lets us retrieve the key given the timestamp, and the
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: timestamp given the key. (Also the value given either one.)
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: That's necessary so that we can reorder the history given a key,
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: and also manipulate the values dict given a timestamp.  #
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: I haven't tried changing history to a List.  An earlier
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: implementation of history as a List was slower than what's here,
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: but the two implementations aren't directly comparable."""
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """A NullCache implements the Cache interface (the interface that
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: LRUCache implements), but doesn't store any values."""
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """Set the capacity of the entity cache."""
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f
